newsitem.title: USA: Sony, Discovery to co-develop 3D, 2D films.
newsitem.headline: Sony, Discovery to co-develop 3D, 2D films.

text.p: Sony Corp of America and Discovery Channel Pictures said on Thursday they had formed a non-exclusive agreement to jointly develop and produce 3D and 2D large format films.
Sony has five such film projects in development and would work with Discovery on their worldwide distribution and marketing, the companies said in a statement.

Discovery owns a network of retail stores, including the Nature Company and Scientific Revolution stores, and television channels, including the Discovery Channel, the Learning Channel and Animal Planet.
Sony's large film format division has already produced two films -- Across the Sea of Time and Wings of Courage, the companies said.
Sony also planned to open a new large screen IMAX theatre in Tokyo in 1996, a large format theatre in San Francisco and another in Berlin, they said.
